page.title: 18 Water Supply
page.content: The water supply is the responsibility of the {Anglian Water Board,the largest Board in the country.} Rain and river water is collected and stored at Grafham Reservoir which was man made to abstract water from the river Great Ouse.The water then goes to the large Hannington Reservoir which holds 6000,000 gallons.The water goes to the treatment works where it is purified by the addition of chemicals & chlorine & is filtered.Northants is a flat county & because the land is not sufficiently high for resevoirs,water storage towers have to be built on the highest land in the area.Our water is piped from Hannington and pumped into storage towers at Doddington and Earls Barton.
